qas.question: When did buda king casimir issue the heir to his nephew?
who issied the first country wide privilege for the nobility?

answers.text: Buda King Casimir III the Great

qas.question: WHo is the nephew of buda king casimer III the great?
What was promised by Buda King Casimer?

answers.text: the nobility would no longer be subject to 'extraordinary' taxes

qas.question: WHo would pay for expenses during travels or the royal courts?

context: In <a0_0>1355<a0_0/> in <a1_0>Buda King Casimir III the Great<a1_0/> issued the first country-wide privilege for the nobility, in exchange for their agreement that in the lack of Casimir's male heirs, the throne would pass to his nephew, <a2_0>Louis I of Hungary<a2_0/>. He decreed that <a3_0>the nobility would no longer be subject to 'extraordinary' taxes<a3_0/>, or use their own funds for military expeditions abroad. He also promised that during travels of the royal court, <a4_0>the king and the court<a4_0/> would pay for all expenses, instead of using facilities of local nobility.
